feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 13 at 8:59PM AKST until November 14 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. * WHERE...White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 10:22PM EST until November 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The river is forecast to remain in Minor Flood Stage through midweek due to breezy northeasterly winds and tides. Rain forecast later this week could cause a slower decline than currently forecast.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 13 at 4:42PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall Possible Eastern Areas Of South Florida Middle Of This Week... A frontal boundary will move northward from the Florida Straits into South Florida during the middle of this week, as a non- tropical low moves eastward from the northern Gulf of Mexico into Northern Florida Peninsula. entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY FOR PORTIONS OF MAUI AND HAWAII COUNTIES THROUGH TUESDAY... .Strong northeast trade winds are expected to become especially gusty tonight as a cold front moves through the island chain. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 14 at 2:32AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Enhanced Fire Danger this Afternoon... The combination of a very dry atmosphere and low fuel moisture will result in an enhanced fire danger this afternoon. Consider burning on a different day. Be sure camp fires are completely extinguished.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 11:56PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Strong south to southwest winds of 25 to 40 mph with gusts over 50 mph are expected through the morning hours along and to the east of the lee slopes of the Prairie Coteau in northeast South Dakota. The locations most affected will be the higher terrain areas of the Sisseton Hills as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills.
